huntMaster.PRINT_HUNT_NAME: Bull Moose Statewide Permit - Hunt# MB1000
huntMaster.SPECIAL_PROVISIONS: This permit is available as the Statewide Sportsman's Permit by applying for the permit in the late fall or by obtaining the Statewide Conservation Permit available to purchase through the approved conservation organization. See guidebook or contact a regional office for details.
huntMaster.NOTES:
Baiting big game for the purposes of hunting is now illegal in Utah.
Click here for more information.

The use of all trail cameras (including both non-handheld transmitting and non-transmitting devices) in the harvest or to aid in the harvest of big game is prohibited between July 31 and Dec. 31. Click here for more information.
huntMaster.HARVEST_REPORTING: REQUIRED: click here or call 1-800-221-0659 to report your harvest. You must report your harvest, even if you did not take an animal, within 30 days of the season end date that is printed on your permit; failure to do so may result in you not being able to apply for big game species in subsequent years. Submitting teeth or other biological samples from your animal, or having your animal checked by a DWR representative or CWMU operator does NOT fulfill your mandatory harvest reporting requirement.

huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: Federal, State, and Private lands comprise this unit.  Most of the land east of Cache Valley in Cache County is US Forest Service land, with some private and State intermixed.
huntBoundaryInfos.WMA_IN_UNIT: Richmond WMA, Providence Canyon WMA, Coldwater WMA, Millville Face WMA, Hardware Ranch WMA, Woodruff Coop WMA.
huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO:
For camping information see the BLM and Forest Service Websites. Camping is allowed on the Hardware Ranch WMA as well.

USFS: http://www.fs.usda.gov/recarea/uwcnf/recarea/?recid=8985

BLM: http://www.blm.gov/ut/st/en/fo/salt_lake.html

Hardware Ranch: http://wildlife.utah.gov/hardwareranch/
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIM_ACCESS_PTS: Logan Canyon, Blacksmith Fork Canyon, Temple Canyon, Franklin Basin, Sinks, Temple Fork, Left Hand Fork, Right Hand Fork.
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS: See USFS and BLM sites for travel plans and ATV regulations.
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES: Mostly public with private interspersed.  Obtain written permission to access private land.
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Box Elder, Cache, Rich and Weber counties—Boundary begins at I-15 and the Utah-Idaho state line; south on I-15 to US-91; east on US-91 to US-89/91; north on US-89/91 to SR-101; east on SR-101 to Hardware Ranch and USFS Road 054 (Ant Flat road); south on USFS Road 054 to SR-39; east on SR-39 to SR-16 in Woodruff; southeast on SR-16 to the Utah-Wyoming state line; north along this state line to the Utah-Idaho state line; west along this state line to I-15. Excludes all CWMUs. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Tremonton, Logan, Ogden. Boundary questions? Call the Ogden office, 801-476-2740.

huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO: Very limited, except in the Whitney reservoir area.
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIM_ACCESS_PTS: Chalk Creek road near Coalville, Utah. Highway 150 south of Evanston Wyoming.
huntBoundaryInfos.SUGGESTED_MAPS: USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Kings Peak, Ogden, Salt Lake City. USFS Kamas Ranger District map
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS: Very Limited except for USFS land near Whitney Resivoir
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Primarily private land--Summit and Duchesne counties--Boundary begins at I-84 and I-80 near Echo; northeast on I-80 to the Utah-Wyoming state line; southeast along this state line to SR-150; south on SR-150 to Pass Lake and the Weber River trail; west on this trail to Holiday Park and CR 2596 (Weber Canyon road); west on this road to SR-32; northwest on SR-32 to I-80 at Wanship; north on I-80 to I-84 near Echo. This hunt is comprised of all or largely private property. Hunters should acquire written permission from the landowner before applying for this hunt. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Kings Peak, Ogden, Salt Lake City. Boundary questions? Call the Ogden office, (801) 476-2740.

Morgan and Summit counties—Boundary begins at the junction of I-80 and I-84 at Echo; west on I-80 to the Salt Lake-Summit county line at Parley’s Summit; north along this county line to the Salt Lake-Morgan county line; north along this county line to the Morgan-Davis county line; north along this county line to I-84; east on I-84 to I-80 at Echo Junction. This hunt is comprised of all or largely private property. Hunters should acquire written permission from the landowner before applying for this hunt. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Ogden, Salt Lake City. Boundary questions? Call the Ogden office, 801-476-2740.

huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO: Campgrounds can be found on the Forest Service along the Monte Cristo Highway. Please visit https://www.fs.usda.gov/uwcnf for more details
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIM_ACCESS_PTS: Use Hwy 39 to access Forest Service land. Use  I-84  and exit onto Henefer Rd or Echo Rd to access Henefer/Echo WMA
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS: Limited ATV access south of Hwy 39 on Forest Service.  No motorized vehicles on Henefer Echo WMA
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Morgan, Rich, Summit and Weber counties--Boundary begins at I-80 and the Utah-Wyoming state line; west on I-80 to Echo Junction and I-84; west on I-84 to SR-167 at Mountain Green (Trappers Loop Road); north along SR-167 to SR-39; east along SR-39 to Woodruff and SR-16; southeast on SR-16 to the Utah-Wyoming state line; south along the state line to I-80. Excludes all CWMUs. This hunt is comprised of all or largely private property.  Hunters should acquire written permission from the landowner before applying for this hunt. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Logan, Ogden. Boundary questions? Call the Ogden office, 801-476-2740.

huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO: US Forest Service campgrounds managed by the Mtn. View-Evanston Wyoming ranger District
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIM_ACCESS_PTS: SR-150 south from Evanston, Wyo., SR-246 south from Mtn. View Wyo
huntBoundaryInfos.SUGGESTED_MAPS: Uinta-Wasatch-Cache National Froests Salt Lake, Kamas, Evanston, Mtn. View Ranger Districts
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS: See USFS motor vehicle map for the Mtn. View-Evanston Ranger District
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Summit County--Boundary begins at the Utah-Wyoming state line and SR-150; south on SR-150 to the Summit-Duchesne county line at Hayden Pass; east on this county line to the head of Burnt Fork drainage bottom(Divide Pass/Island Lake); north along this drainage bottom to the Utah-Wyoming state line; west on this state line to SR-150. Excludes all CWMUs. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Kings Peak. Boundary questions? Call Ogden office, 801-476-2740.

huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS: Check with Forest Service.  Mostly just the Wastach front
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Davis, Morgan, Salt Lake and Summit counties--Boundary begins at Echo Junction and I-80; southwest along I-80 to I-15; north on I-15 to its junction with I-84 near Ogden; east on I-84 to Echo Junction. This hunt is comprised of all or largely private property. Hunters should acquire written permission from the landowner before applying for this hunt. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Salt Lake City, Ogden. Boundary questions? Call the Ogden office, 801-476-2740.

huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: 90% Public Land - US Forest Service and BLM lands.
huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO:
All Campgrounds on this unit are managed by the US Forest Service and BLM. Camping outside of official campgrounds is also permitted on most of the public lands. Please direct all questions regarding campground availability and other camping questions to the US Forest Service. Maps and camping regulations are available on their websites.
Ashley National Forest: http://www.fs.usda.gov/main/ashley/home
Uinta-Wasatch-Cache National Forest: http://www.fs.usda.gov/main/uwcnf/
huntBoundaryInfos.COUNTY_ROAD_INFO: County Road Access information: http://www.daggettcounty.org/index.aspx?nid=17 and http://www.utahcommuterlink.com/
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS:
Most roads and ATV trails on this unit are managed by the US Forest Service or BLM and are covered on their Travel Management Plans. Please direct all questions regarding which roads and trails ATVs can be operated on to the US Forest Service. There is no vehicle access allowed on Baretop.
Ashley National Forest: http://www.fs.usda.gov/detail/ashley/home/?cid=STELPRDB5432815
Uinta-Wasatch-Cache National Forest: http://www.fs.usda.gov
BLM: http://www.blm.gov/ut/st/en/fo/vernal.html
Most areas are closed to off road vehicle use except on designated routes.
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES: The boundary of this hunt unit does not include Tribal Trust Lands and does not have much private land included.  Hunters should receive written permission from private landowners prior to the start of the hunts if they wish to hunt private property.
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Daggett and Summit counties—Boundary begins at the Utah-Wyoming-Colorado state line (Three Corners); south on the Utah-Colorado state line to the Green River; west along the Green River to Flaming Gorge Reservoir; west along the south shoreline of Flaming Gorge Reservoir to Cart Creek; south along this creek to US-191; south on US-191 to the Uintah/Daggett county line (summit of the Uinta Mountains); west along this summit to the head of Burnt Fork drainage (Divide Pass/Island Lake); north along the Burnt Fork drainage bottom and Burnt Fork Creek to the Utah-Wyoming state line; east on this state line to the Utah-Wyoming-Colorado state line (Three Corners). USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Dutch John, Kings Peak.  Boundary questions?  Call the Vernal office, 435-781-9453.

huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: 65% of the unit is public land.  There is private property on Diamond Mountain; contact Diamond Mountain Landowner Association for information.
huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO: All Campgrounds on this unit are managed by the US Forest Service. Camping outside of official campgrounds is also permitted on most of the public lands. Please direct all questions regarding campground availability and other camping questions to the US Forest Service. Maps and camping regulations are available on their website. Ashley National Forest: http://www.fs.usda.gov/main/ashley/home
huntBoundaryInfos.SUGGESTED_MAPS: USGS 1:100,000 Vernal and Dutch John topo maps or BLM version equivalent that shows landownership.
huntBoundaryInfos.COUNTY_ROAD_INFO: County Road Access information: http://www.co.uintah.ut.us/roads/roaddept.php and http://www.utahcommuterlink.com/ and http://www.daggettcounty.org/index.aspx?nid=17
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS:
Most roads and ATV trails on this unit are managed by the US Forest Service, BLM, or DWR and are covered on their Travel Management Plans. Please direct all questions regarding which roads and trails ATVs can be operated on to the US Forest Service. There is no off-road vehicle use allowed on DWR lands except on established roads and trails.
Ashley National Forest: http://www.fs.usda.gov/detail/ashley/home/?cid=STELPRDB5432815
BLM: http://www.blm.gov/ut/st/en/fo/vernal.html
Most areas are closed to off road vehicle use except on designated routes.
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES: The boundary of this hunt unit does include some Tribal Trust Lands and has private land included.  The majority of Ute Tribal Trust Land is in the south part of the hunt unit where there isn’t moose habitat.  There is private property on Diamond Mountain.  You should receive written permission from the landowner before hunting on private property.
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Daggett and Uintah counties—Boundary begins at the Green River and the Utah-Colorado state line; west along the Green River to Flaming Gorge Reservoir; west along the south shoreline of Flaming Gorge Reservoir to Cart Creek; south along this creek to US-191; south on US-191 to the Uintah/Daggett county line (summit of the Uinta Mountains); west along this summit to the Dry Fork-Whiterocks drainage divide; southwest along the divide to USFS Trail #025 and Whiterocks Lake; south along the lake and trail to the East Fork of the Whiterocks River;  south along this river to the Whiterocks river; south along this river to to the Uintah River; south along this river to the Duchesne River; south along this river to the Green River; south along this river to the White River; east along this river to the Utah-Colorado state line; north on this state line to the Green River. EXCLUDES ALL NATIVE AMERICAN TRUST LANDS WITHIN THIS BOUNDARY. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Dutch John, Seep Ridge, Vernal. Boundary questions? Call the Vernal office, 435-781-9453.

huntBoundaryInfos.SUGGESTED_MAPS: Any that depict private and public lands
huntBoundaryInfos.COUNTY_ROAD_INFO: Not a lot of road access
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Box Elder, Cache, Morgan and Weber counties—Boundary begins at US-91 and SR-101 west of Hyrum; east on SR-101 to Hardware Ranch and USFS Road 054 (Ant Flat Road); south on this road to SR-39; southwest on SR-39 to SR-167 (Trappers Loop Road); south on SR-167 to I-84 (Exit 92); west on I-84 to I-15; north on I-15 to US-91; northeast on US-91 to SR-101 west of Hyrum. This hunt is comprised of all or largely private property. Excludes all CWMUs. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Logan, Ogden, Promontory Point. Boundary questions? Call the Ogden office, 801-476-2740.

huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO: Administered by USFS, Kamas Ranger district.
huntBoundaryInfos.SUGGESTED_MAPS: USFS Kamas Ranger district oUSGS 1:100,000 Maps: Kings Peak, Salt Lake City.
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS: Administered by USFS, please refer to travel map for the Kamas Ranger district.
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES: Must have written permission to access private property
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Summit and Wasatch counties—Boundary begins at I-80 and SR-32 at Wanship; south on SR-32 to Oakley and the Weber Canyon road (CR-2596); east on this road to Holiday Park and the Weber River Trail; east on this trail to SR-150 near Pass Lake; south and west on SR-150 to North Fork Provo River; south along  this river to the Provo River; south along this river to SR-35; west on SR-35 to Francis and SR-32; west on SR-32 to US-40; north on US-40 to I-80; north on I-80 to SR-32 at Wanship. Excludes all CWMUs. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Kings Peak, Salt Lake City. Boundary questions? Call the Ogden office, 801-476-2740.

huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: Public lands are all Forest Service lands managed by the Ashley and Uinta-Wasatch-Cache National Forests.  This unit includes a large portion of the High Uintas Wilderness Area where all motor vehicles are prohibited.  This unit also includes large tracts of Ute tribal lands that are closed to non-tribal members.  The tribal lands are mostly the lower elevation sagebrush zone but in some areas they reach up into the aspen/conifer zone.  There is a large amount of private property on the unit too.  Most of the private property is below the tribal boundary but there are several parcels of private property in the canyon bottoms.
huntBoundaryInfos.WMA_IN_UNIT: Little Montes Creek WMA north of Ballard and Kevin Conway WMA southeast of Myton.  Elk, bear and cougar are rarely found on these WMAs.
huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO:
All Campgrounds on this unit are managed by the US Forest Service. Camping outside of official campgrounds is also permitted on most of the forest. There are special restrictions on camping and campfires in certain areas within the Wilderness area. Please direct all questions regarding campground availability and other camping questions to the US Forest Service. Maps and camping regulations are available on their websites.
Ashley National Forest website: http://www.fs.usda.gov/ashley
Uinta-Wasatch-Cache National Forest website: http://www.fs.usda.gov/uwcnf
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIM_ACCESS_PTS: The main access points for the High Uintas Wilderness include: Uinta Canyon Trailhead, West Fork of Whiterocks Trailhead, Chepeta Trailhead, Lake Fork Trailhead, Yellowstone/Swift Creek Trailhead, Jackson Park road, Dry Gulch road, Rock Creek Trailhead, North Fork of Duchesne Trailhead, and Grandview trailheads
huntBoundaryInfos.SUGGESTED_MAPS: USGS 1:100,000 Kings Peak and Duchesne topo maps
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS: All roads and ATV trails on this unit are managed by the US Forest Service and are covered on their Travel Management Plans. Please direct all questions regarding which roads and trails ATVs can be operated on to the US Forest Service. Maps can also be purchased online at:http://www.fs.usda.gov/ashley
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES: The hunt unit does not include the Ute tribal lands.  There is a large tract of Ute tribal trust land that stretches east to west across the South Slope of the Uinta Mountains.  Road access across the tribal land is permitted only across the main access roads to the Forest.  All ATVs are prohibited on tribal Lands, they must be trailered on access roads across tribal Lands.
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Duchesne, Summit, Uintah and Wasatch counties—Boundary begins at SR-87 and US-40 in Duchesne; north on SR-87 to SR-35; northwest on SR-35 to the Provo River; north along this river to North Fork Provo River; north along this river to SR-150; east and north on SR-150 to the Summit-Duchesne county line (summit of the Uinta Mountains) at Hayden Pass; east along the summit of the Uinta Mountains to the Dry Fork-Whiterocks drainage divide; south atop this divide to USFS Trail #025; southwest on this trail to Whiterocks Lake and the East Fork of the Whiterocks River; south along this river to the Whiterocks River; south along this river to the Uinta River; south along this river to the Duchesne River; west along this river to US-40 at Myton; west on US-40 to SR-87 in Duchesne. EXCLUDES ALL NATIVE AMERICAN TRUST LAND WITHIN THIS BOUNDARY. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Duchesne, Dutch John, Kings Peak, Provo, Salt Lake City, Vernal. Boundary questions? Call the Vernal office, 435-781-9453.

huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO: All Campgrounds on this unit are managed by the US Forest Service. Camping outside of official campgrounds is also permitted on most of the Forest. Please direct all questions regarding campground availability and other camping questions to the US Forest Service. Maps and camping regulations are available on their websites. Avintaquin: http://www.fs.usda.gov/ashley Currant Creek: http://www.fs.usda.gov/uwcnf Wasatch West: http://www.fs.usda.gov/uwcnf
huntBoundaryInfos.COUNTY_ROAD_INFO:
PROJECT DESCRIPTION Central Federal Lands Highway Division (CFLHD), in partnership with Wasatch County, Utah County, and the United States Forest Service (USFS) is planning to improve Strawberry Sheep Creek Road, a 31.9 mile route between US-6 and US-40. This road is really 
ROAD CLOSURE CONSIDERATIONS The key objective is to construct these roadway improvements while minimizing impacts to public users. To facilitate public safety, certain segments of the road will be closed during various construction activities. When the road is open, delays up to 30 minutes can be expected. The construction schedule is subject to change. During road closures, no motorized vehicles will be permitted on the route. Adjacent Off Highway Vehicle (OHV) trail routes will continue to be open during road closures. Where a potential conflict between an OHV and construction equipment is possible, the OHV access will be restricted for public safety. Emergency access will be permitted at all times.
ROAD CLOSURE PRELIMINARY SCHEDULE
a combination of three smaller routes, Sheep Creek – Rays Valley Road (FR 70051); Unicorn Ridge – Indian Creek Road (FR 70042); and West Side Strawberry Road (FR 70131). The construction work will be split into four segments: Segment 1 (FR 70051) begins at the MP 0.0 (intersection with US-6) and ends at MP 7.0 (FR 70042). The work on Segment 1 consists of pavement rehabilitation including patching, crack sealing, and chip sealing. Segment 2 and Segment 3 (FR 70042) begins at MP 7.0 and ends at FR 70131. The work on Segment 2 and 3 consists of roadway bench widening, paving, drainage improvements, and safety improvements. Segment 4 (FR 70131) begins at the intersection with FR 70042 and ends 3.75 miles north of the intersection. The work on Segment 4 consists of pavement rehabilitation, pulverizing, and paving with subexcavation as needed.
QUESTIONS? Wasatch County Public Works 1891 West 3000 South Heber City, Utah 84032 435-654-1661 www.wasatch.utah.gov
Utah County
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS:
Most roads and ATV trails on this unit are managed by the US Forest Service and are covered on their Travel Management Plans. Please direct all questions regarding which roads and trails ATVs can be operated on to the US Forest Service. Avintaquin: http://www.fs.usda.gov/ashley Currant Creek: http://www.fs.usda.gov/uwcnf Wasatch West: http://www.fs.usda.gov/uwcnf

There are also several roads and ATV trails on land managed by the Utah Division of Wildlife Resources. All vehicles and ATV’s must stay on designated roads and trails on these lands.
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES: Wasatch West, Currant Creek and Avintaquin subunits contain large amounts of Tribal Trust Lands. All ATVs are prohibited on Tribal Lands and must be trailered on access roads across Tribal Lands.  For information on which roads are legal access roads contact Duchesne County. There are also several large areas of private land on both subunits, including 7 large CWMU’s. Hunters must receive written permission before hunting private lands. Wasatch Mountains OIAL moose permits are not valid on moose CWMU’s. There are 2 moose CWMU’s on the Currant Creek subunit (Moon’s Ranch and Little Red Creek), and 3 moose CWMU’s on the Wasatch West Subunit (Three C, Coyote/Little Pole and Wallsburg).
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Carbon, Duchesne, Emery, Juab, Millard, Salt Lake, Sanpete, Sevier, Summit, Utah and Wasatch counties—Boundary begins at the junction of I-15 and I-80 in Salt Lake City; east on I-80 to US-40; south on US-40 to SR-32; east on SR-32 to SR-35; southeast on SR-35 to SR-87; south on SR-87 to Duchesne and US-191; south on US-191 to US-6; southeast on US-6 to Price and SR-10; south on SR-10 to I-70; west on I-70 to US-50 at Salina; northwest on US-50 to I-15 at Scipio; north on I-15 to I-80 in Salt Lake City. EXCLUDING ALL NATIVE AMERICAN TRUST LAND WITHIN THIS BOUNDARY. Excludes all CWMUs. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Delta, Duchesne, Huntington, Manti, Nephi, Price, Provo, Salina, Salt Lake City. Boundary questions? Call the Springville office, 801-491-5678; the Vernal office, 435-781-9453; or the Price office, 435-613-3700.
